Myself Again - Lyric Video","embedCodeIframe":"<iframe title="YouTube video player" class="youtube-player" type="text/html" width="425" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hsy8HI0Zr-4" frameborder="0" allowFullScreen></iframe>"}],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"<iframe title="YouTube video player" class="youtube-player" type="text/html" width="425" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hsy8HI0Zr-4" frameborder="0" allowFullScreen></iframe>","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"http://creaturecanopy.com/","urlMySpace":"","urlFacebook":"https://www.facebook.com/creaturecanopy/?fref=ts","urlTwitter":"","twitterScreenName":""}],"supports":[{"id":1745523,"name":"OptycNerd","startTime":null,"eventDescription":"","isMobileFriendly":"false","image":null,"youtubeVideos":[],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"","urlMySpace":"","urlFacebook":"","urlTwitter":"","twitterScreenName":""},{"id":1745525,"name":"Compass & Cavern","startTime":null,"eventDescription":"","isMobileFriendly":"false","image":null,"youtubeVideos":[],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"","urlMySpace":"","urlFacebook":"","urlTwitter":"","twitterScreenName":""},{"id":1745527,"name":"Medic","startTime":null,"eventDescription":""Sometimes you have to begin again”, says lead singer Aaron Wagner, which seems ironic and premature to say regarding the bands ethereal but pop-laden debut album Olympia, but that’s how the battle hardened but hopeful trio sees it. 

Since 2011, MEDIC has been traveling the country playing bars, clubs, schools, and main stage at festivals upwards of 50,000 people representing their 5 song debut EP Grace and Gravity. Over the years the band has enjoyed success on those 5 songs they never even dreamed while navigating the many successes and trails of growing up. Getting married, buying houses, life, death, and beyond, the band used all the experience stored up in the last five years to give us a transparent album that doesn’t dare placate to the listener with cliches and emotional band-aids but a solidarity and earnestness to press on in the face of personal adversity. 

Taking notes from successful startup entrepreneurs, the band spent 3 months waking up at 5am and meeting at the studio to craft songs before having to return to their day jobs at the strike of 9. “We had no time. Or so we thought.” quips the bands bassist Drew Barnard, “we realized that there is a whole section of day no one seems to be doing anything and as hard as it was, we made it happen. Everyday. 5am.” The level of devotion the band took to wake up daily served as a muse to craft the album they always wanted to make after having struggled for years to dish up a complete work. “We tried to make an album probably six different times. Sometimes with an outside producer and others by ourselves. We actually started recording by planning on just making demos while we found a producer.” says Aaron, “when we took a step back and listened, we really loved the way things were turning out and got it to a point where we had gotten our ideas out and then wanted to put some extra ears on it.” 

The band sought out the production expertise of Dallas composer, Brad Nyght (AirBnB, Tesla, ESPN). “When I was in high school, Brad was in Colorado Springs and I used to go down to his studio and just watch--I essentially learned everything I know from him. When the time came to let someone in on it, he was the first person I called.” says Aaron. Taking an autobiographical approach to each song lent itself to Brad’s signature and cinematic approach. "The magic of the songs of Olympia is each one brings you into it’s own unique world while still sounding cohesive.” says Dominick.

Developing a sound that’s well beyond their years and still true to their youth, MEDIC completed the lean but powerful 9 track work, Olympia, an album that the band says is altogether a goodbye and hello. A goodbye to a five year season and all of the trimmings of what life can throw your way and a hello to what is to come, which after listening is a bright future
